metadata.titel_preek: An der Furt – Da rang einer mit ihm bis zur Morgenröte

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human subject faces life's painful transitions and 'dark rivers' (crises, aging, death) and must actively wrestle with a seemingly hostile God to extract a blessing and find meaning.

subject.identificatie: The Human / The Hearer (identified with Jacob)
tekstueel_bewijs: Jakob ringt mit Gott... Er kämpft die ganze Nacht.
Wir sollen nicht verzweifeln, sondern dieses ringend bestehen.
Ich ringe, ich kämpfe wie Jakob, so möchte ich werden.
Ich lasse dich nicht, du segnest mich denn.
dass dieses, was aussieht wie Zerstörung... ein Segen werden kann.
Ich gebe mich selbst nicht auf. Ich werfe mich nicht weg.
Sodass wir unser Leben lieb haben, auch dann, wenn es zu Ende geht.
All das mag uns helfen, aber das Ringen, das müssen wir schon selber tun.
helper.rol_van_god: Opponent (God is the one being wrestled with)

tegenstander.identificatie: God (as the 'Dark Power' or 'Demon') / Fate / Despair
tekstueel_bewijs: Gott überfällt uns... Gott hat auch die Kraft, furchtbare Dinge auf uns zu häufen.
Lasst uns weiter ringen mit diesem Dämon, der uns überfällt.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: God is framed as the source of suffering and the one who must be overcome or 'coerced' to yield a blessing.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: Political and social activism (Peace, Justice, Ecology) as a form of wrestling with God.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Activist / The Preacher
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Peace / Justice / Bread for the hungry
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: Social action is framed as the same 'wrestling' movement as personal crisis management.

voorbeelden_mens_subject: Ich halte an dir fest, Gott.
Wir werfen uns Gott in den Weg.
Wir müssen das Ringen selber tun.

voorbeelden: Das Ringen, das müssen wir schon selber tun.
Wir müssen über den dunklen Fluss.
Ich gebe dich nicht auf, Gott.
Ich will so werden wie Jakob.
Wir mögen in diesem Kampf Abschied nehmen lernen.
Wir können nichts anderes mehr tun als beten.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is a 'Recruitment' sermon focused on the human will (Vouloir) to persist and the obligation (Devoir) to struggle. God's power (Pouvoir) is passive or obstructive until forced by human persistence.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (God attacks) through ~S1 (temptation to give up) to S1 (forcing the blessing through wrestling).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by human persistence (Jacob's 'I will not let go').
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; God is explicitly identified with the 'blutgieriger Dämon'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: Despite the 'spiritual' language, the actantial structure is purely anthropocentric. The human is the Subject of the rescue; God is the obstacle or the passive resource to be tapped. Grace is not a gift but a trophy of the wrestling match.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Das Ringen, das müssen wir schon selber tun, niemand kommt daran vorbei.
Gott... der darauf wartet gebraucht zu werden.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Jacob is the heroic model for the hearer's own existential struggle.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: God chooses and preserves Jacob despite his fear and past, showing that God's covenant survives even when God seems hidden.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to perform; spiritual exhaustion; view of God as a threat to be managed.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Synergism where the human 'will' is the decisive factor.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon is very coherent in its existential-heroic narrative, but theologically clashing with the biblical concept of Sola Gratia.
spanning_punten: God is the attacker vs. God is the one who loves.
Blessing is a gift vs. Blessing must be 'coerced'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The story of Jacob inspires us to wrestle with our own darkness.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The human brings their own competence (willpower).

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is mostly Jacob's 'betrayal' of Esau, treated as a psychological burden rather than a state of death.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a manual for existential self-help. The human is the hero; God is the problem to be solved.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The human must 'do the wrestling' to get the blessing.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: God is the one who stops Jacob to transform him before the encounter with Esau.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: God did not just let Jacob wrestle; God held Jacob fast so that his old identity could die and a new one be born.

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Focus on Jacob's limp as a sign of God's victory over Jacob's self-reliance.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Emphasize that we *cannot* cross the river alone, but God carries us.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (God/Fate) is already very intense.
tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Shift the opponent from 'God' to 'Sin/Death' which God overcomes for us.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: To move from a pagan 'struggle with the gods' to a Christian 'victory of God'.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: God's election of Jacob (Soteriology) enables Jacob's persistence (Ethics).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is rhetorically powerful and existentially honest, but it risks leaving the hearer alone in the ring with a 'bloodthirsty demon' rather than in the arms of a Savior.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the sermon is empathetic; semiotically, it is a law-driven mandate.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would note Jacob's limp as a defeat of his ego; the sermon treats it as a badge of heroic struggle.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that 'God' functions as the 'Opponent' actant here, which is a radical theological inversion.

volledige_subject_lijst: Wir werfen uns in den Weg
appendices.notities: The sermon uses 'God' as a label for the difficulties of life, making the theology essentially deistic or pantheistic in its functional structure.
